statements.name: PROC STEPDISC
statements.description: Given a classification variable and several quantitative variables, the STEPDISC procedure performs a stepwise discriminant analysis to select a subset of the quantitative variables for use in discriminating among the classes.

arguments.name: ALL
arguments.description: Activates all of the display options.

arguments.name: BCORR
arguments.description: Displays between-class correlations.

arguments.name: BCOV
arguments.description: Displays between-class covariances.

arguments.name: BSSCP
arguments.description: Displays the between-class SSCP matrix.

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: Specifies the data set to be analyzed. The data set can be an ordinary SAS data set or one of several specially structured data sets created by statistical procedures available with SAS/STAT software.

arguments.name: INCLUDE=
arguments.description: Includes the first n variables in the VAR statement in every model. By default, INCLUDE=0.

arguments.name: MAXMACRO=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of macro variables with independent variable lists to create.

arguments.name: MAXSTEP=
arguments.description: Specifies the maximum number of steps. By default, MAXSTEP= two times the number of variables in the VAR statement.

arguments.name: METHOD=
arguments.description: Specifies the method used to select the variables in the model.

arguments.name: BACKWARD
arguments.description: Specifies backward elimination.

arguments.name: FORWARD
arguments.description: Specifies forward selection.

arguments.name: STEPWISE
arguments.description: Specifies stepwise selection.

arguments.name: PCORR
arguments.description: Displays pooled within-class correlations (partial correlations based on the pooled within-class covariances).

arguments.name: PCOV
arguments.description: Displays pooled within-class covariances.

arguments.name: PR2ENTRY=
arguments.description: Specifies the partial R square for adding variables in the forward selection mode, where p ≤ 1.

arguments.name: PR2STAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the partial R square for retaining variables in the backward elimination mode, where p ≤ 1.

arguments.name: PSSCP
arguments.description: Displays the pooled within-class corrected SSCP matrix.

arguments.name: SHORT
arguments.description: Suppresses the displayed output from each step.

arguments.name: SIMPLE
arguments.description: Displays simple descriptive statistics for the total sample and within each class.

arguments.name: SINGULAR=
arguments.description: Specifies the singularity criterion for entering variables, where O<p<1.

arguments.name: SLENTRY=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level for adding variables in the forward selection mode, where 0 ≤ p ≤ 1. The default value is 0.15.

arguments.name: SLSTAY=
arguments.description: Specifies the significance level for retaining variables in the backward elimination mode, where 0 ≤ p ≤ 1. The default value is 0.15.

arguments.name: START=
arguments.description: Specifies that the first n variables in the VAR statement be used to begin the selection process.

arguments.name: STDMEAN
arguments.description: Displays total-sample and pooled within-class standardized class means.

arguments.name: STOP=
arguments.description: Specifies the number of variables in the final model.

arguments.name: TCORR
arguments.description: Displays total-sample correlations.

arguments.name: TCOV
arguments.description: Displays total-sample covariances.

arguments.name: TSSCP
arguments.description: Displays the total-sample corrected SSCP matrix.

arguments.name: WCORR
arguments.description: Displays within-class correlations for each class level.

arguments.name: WCOV
arguments.description: Displays within-class covariances for each class level.

arguments.name: WSSCP
arguments.description: Displays the within-class corrected SSCP matrix for each class level.

statements.name: BY
statements.description: Obtains separate analyses on observations in groups defined by the BY variables.

arguments.name: DESCENDING
arguments.description: Specifies that the observations are sorted in descending order by the variable that immediately follows the word DESCENDING in the BY statement.

arguments.name: NOTSORTED
arguments.description: Specifies that observations are not necessarily sorted in alphabetic or numeric order.

statements.name: CLASS
statements.description: The values of the CLASS variable define the groups for analysis. Class levels are determined by the formatted values of the CLASS variable. The CLASS variable can be numeric or character.

statements.name: FREQ
statements.description: If a variable in the data set represents the frequency of occurrence for the other values in the observation, include the name of the variable in a FREQ statement. The procedure then treats the data set as if each observation appears n times, where n is the value of the FREQ variable for the observation.

statements.name: VAR
statements.description: The VAR statement specifies the quantitative variables eligible for selection. The default is all numeric variables not listed in other statements.

statements.name: WEIGHT
statements.description: To use relative weights for each observation in the input data set, place the weights in a variable in the data set and specify the name in a WEIGHT statement. This is often done when the variance associated with each observation is different and the values of the WEIGHT variable are proportional to the reciprocals of the variances.
